abstract: Vice Pres Biden's cooperative relationship with finance industry as Delaware senator could raise suspicions of liberal voters, complicating his presidential campaign; supporters say record as vice president reflects dedication to consumer protection, but critics including Sen Elizabeth Warren point to Biden's leading congressional role in 2005 consumer anti-bankruptcy bill.
lead_paragraph: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., who is considering a run for the presidency, may have to persuade voters that his approach to consumer issues has evolved since he was a senator from Delaware, where many financial services companies are based.

headline.main: Banking Ties Could Hurt Joe Biden in Race With Populist Overtone
headline.print_headline: Ties to Banking Could Haunt Biden in a Race With Populist Overtones

snippet: Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr., who is considering a run for the presidency, may have to persuade voters that his approach to consumer issues has evolved since he was a senator from Delaware, where many financial services companies are based.
